benchmark_details.name: NoisyEQA
benchmark_details.overview: The NoisyEQA benchmark is designed to evaluate an agentâ€™s ability to recognize and correct noisy questions across four common types of noise: Latent Hallucination Noise, Memory Noise, Perception Noise, and Semantic Noise.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate agents' performance against noisy questions and improve their robustness in real-world scenarios.

data.source: Generated using a novel LLM-powered framework.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the ability of agents to detect and correct noisy questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in terms of noise detection and correction.
methodology.validation: Evaluation revealed that agents struggle with noise detection, leading to erroneous responses.
